org.simplity.http

Class HttpGateway.Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.http.HttpGateway.Agent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OutboundAgent
    Enclosing class:
    HttpGateway

    public class HttpGateway.Agent
extends Object
implements OutboundAgent
    a worker inner-class that re-uses set-up time parameters from its parent instance and manages state across method invocations with its own attributes
    Author:
    simplity.org

        public Agent()

    • Method Detail

      • setConnectionParams

        public void setConnectionParams(String path,
                                String httpMethod,
                                String[] headerNamesToSend,
                                String[] values,
                                String contentType)
        set connection parameter before calling serve method
        Parameters:
        path - only the specific path, possibly with query string, but with no protocol, domain or port. this is appended with the baseURL for the connection
        httpMethod - valid http method. null to use the default method.
        headerNamesToSend - list of header fields to be set. if non-null, values must also be provided in the next parameter.
        values - associate array for headerNamesToSend with values for each
        contentType - null to leave it as default

      • serve

        public boolean serve(ServiceContext ctx,
                     OutputData dataTobeSent,
                     InputData dataToBeReceived)
        Specified by:
        serve in interface OutboundAgent
        Parameters:
        ctx - service context in which the caller service is executing
        dataTobeSent - what data needs to be sent along with this request. if null, no need to send any more data. However, in case of standards like swagger, agent may be equipped to extract whatever data is required as per the swagger specification
        dataToBeReceived - what data is expected back. If null, it is left to the agent to probably extract all the data into ctx
        Returns:
        true if all OK, and the response received from the service is put back into the service context. false in case of any problem in locating, contacting or getting the response from the server that is known to serve this service. Error message is added to the service context

      • getStatus

        public long getStatus()
        Returns:
        http response status code

      • getHeaders

        public String[] getHeaders(String[] names)
        Parameters:
        names -
        Returns:
        array of values received for the header field names
